title: "Industrial" sans serif
content:
Hi.

Does anyone know a font similar to this.  
(This font is work-in-progress by Neo Neo design - and looks like it's missing some of the scandinavian glyphs Ø, Æ, Å).

Thanks,

Henning

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [NeoNeo-07.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/typophile.com/files/NeoNeo-07.png) | 53.9 KB |
author: henand

comments.content:
I would start looking at DIN Mittel/Schriften/1451  
For the |a|, Korolev: [http://www.devicefonts.co.uk/cgi-bin/device3.cgi?action=fonts&section=fa...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.devicefonts.co.uk/cgi-bin/device3.cgi?action=fonts&section=family&font=Korolev%20Pro&custom=0&text=&currency=1&vatinc=No%20VAT "http://www.devicefonts.co.uk/cgi-bin/device3.cgi?action=fonts&section=family&font=Korolev%20Pro&custom=0&text=&currency=1&vatinc=No%20VAT")

Agree with Riccardo, to me it also belongs to the DIN family even if obviously some earmarks are absent and details off: single storey /a, /J top bar and serifed /I monospace  
Some more alternatives: [Ciutadella](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/emtype/ciutadella), [Antartida](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/latinotype/antartida), [Decima](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/decima)/ [Decima Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/decima+mono), [Eef](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/parachute/pf-eef), [T-star](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.fontshop.com/families/t-star)/ [T-star Mono](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.fontshop.com/families/t-star-mono), [Rotundus](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dayflash/rotundus), [Simple](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/lineto.com/The+Fonts/Font+Categories/Text+Fonts/Simple), [Karben 205](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/karben+205)/Mono

To add to Ryuk's excellent list: [http://www.indiantypefoundry.com/fonts/indian-type-foundry/pilcrow/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150415101105/http:/www.indiantypefoundry.com/fonts/indian-type-foundry/pilcrow/ "http://www.indiantypefoundry.com/fonts/indian-type-foundry/pilcrow/")

Thanks a lot - DIN feels a bit to perfect - but there's a lot of options that will do the job.

--  
H
